scheme_name: Iron Bloom vs Cast Iron vs Wrought Iron Discrimination
author: Sefy Levy
description: Classify archaeological iron artifacts based on carbon content, slag inclusion composition, and microstructure proxies
reference: Scott, D.A. (1991). Metallography and Microstructure of Ancient and Historic Metals. Getty Publications. / Buchwald, V.F. (2005). Iron and Steel in Ancient Times.

classifications.name: BLOOMERY IRON (LOW-CARBON STEEL)
classifications.description: C < 0.3%, numerous slag inclusions, variable P content; solid-state reduction

classifications.name: WROUGHT IRON (VERY LOW CARBON)
classifications.description: C < 0.1%, elongated slag inclusions, almost pure ferrite

classifications.name: STEEL (MEDIUM CARBON)
classifications.description: C 0.3–2.0%, pearlitic microstructure, may be heat-treated

classifications.name: PHOSPHORIC IRON
classifications.description: P > 0.3%, often with ghost structures, common in bloomery iron

classifications.name: INSUFFICIENT METALLOGRAPHIC DATA
classifications.description: Missing C content, microstructure, or slag inclusion data
